text:
Trying to use HubSpot Cli. i have tried a bunch of stuff. still get same error when
running 'hs init'
any help will be greatly appreciated.

/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cli/node_modules/rxjs/dist/esm5/index.js:1
export { Observable } from './internal/Observable';
^^^^^^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'
    at Object.compileFunction (vm.js:344:18)
    at wrapSafe (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1048:15)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1082:27)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1138:10)
    at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:982:32)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:875:14)
    at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1022:19)
    at require (internal/modules/cjs/helpers.js:72:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cli/node_modules/inquirer/lib/ui/prompt.js:7:36)
do you use the latest version?
latest version of node.js and yes latest CLI. well im using npm package manager, so assume so
im on linux, and due for an upgrade, but dont wanna break anything. i dont know if my OS plays any part. sorry sounds stupid. i did have to install dependancies just to get HubSpot CLI installed.
well technically downloaded only

This is because your api does not have access to Tickets scope.
You give you api key access under scope section
Also Please keep your API key confidential, I will strongly recommend to delete this api and create a new one.
actually I am not able to reach my API key via settings as it is mentioned in the documentations
The api was created using public or private app?
its public : Home365HubSpotApp
That works!! Thank you!!
Then you wont be able to access it under portal, You will have switch to your developer account and then open this application (Home365HubSpotApp) and edit the scopes
I am on my developer account and I opened the app there then I went into the Auth tab and added the scopes
What scopes did you added?
Also you’ll need to re authorize your application.
I added what I got in the error response, and the tickets is one of them
And you also reauthorised your application after updating the scopes?
How I am doing it?

Go into the portal on which you have installed this application.
Under Integrations/Connected App, Look for your application and Uninstall it.
And then again follow the authentication steps.
can you please advise why I need to go over all this staff and I just need to create ticket in HubSpot from my back end by calling HubSpot create ticket api
I mean its not enough to create account
for authentication purpose?
If you just want to create tickets with in a your portal, You don’t need to do any of this. You can simply use api key
is the above request valid?
Yes, Seems valid.
where I can see the ticket which was created
this for my test account, what I need to do for production and side branch envs?

You’ll want to make sure that you’re using the API key for your developer account when making the request to the custom actions API, and also make sure that the `appId` you’re using in the request is one of the apps defined by that developer account
and where I can find all the optional params which I can send when creating the ticket
You will just need to change the apis to production api key. and what do you mean by branch env?
You can find all ticket properties under settings/properties.
I meant the exact properties names which I can send in the API
not on the portal

Hi <@U0157R7AQ84>,

I am using the API key and appID from the same developer account but when I am installing the app on a different website than it gives the error which I shared with you above.So can you please let me know what is the issue?
